bow: flew alone for the first time with my 19month old it was 5hr flight from philly to seattle and my daughter had past the exhaustion point and entered into full meltdown mode was trying to ignore my own air sickness while attempting to comfort calm quiet her and losing ve never felt so helpless and defeated as mother found myself sitting in my seat rocking my daughter with tears streaming down my face am terrible at asking accepting help but suddenly found myself wrapped up in the kind embrace of complete strangers on plane the flight crew and fellow passengers rallied around me they offered distractions kind words and their own stories snacks and even lullabies another passenger walked around with my daughter so could get minute to breath she came back with calm baby who was munching away on some crackers like nothing ever happened so don know how else to find you or really express what that act of kindness meant to me but sara from seattle if you are out there thank you thank you and everyone else around us for your compassion congrats on the flight be so nervous to even attempt it well done my so parents live in florida and terrified to take my almost month old on hour flight you re wonder woman and those people are amazing as dad who flies often with kids have girls we found the takeoffs and landing the hardest mainly because kids do know how to pop their ears and repressurise yawning and swallowing can achieve this so make sure they have sippy cup with water or if young enough time your feeding so that you can breastfeed note loosen cap and refasten before giving to kids only once on an international flight to australia 14 hrs did we have meltdown downloading playlist of videos that can be put on loop tablet or ipad etc with decent headphones without parent intervention is priceless my kids loved sesame street or coloring with crayons it great time to fly they re not quite mobile yet so they re generally content to just snuggle also the engine sounds act as giant white noise machine try timing it around nap time or even meal time bottles help with pressure or make sure they have paci believe in you just flew by myself with my mo old and even though missed connecting flight and was stressed for the most part was blown away by how kind and patient and willing to help people were good job mama really glad the people around you were helpful and sympathetic man this is sounding better and better lol removed oh my gosh that was me sarah in seattle so glad that could help out was hesitant if you would accept at first but know that was helped when flying alone with my son when he was little and had to pay it forward happy could give you little break hope you are relaxing today yes book seat near the plane wing engine normally sit there to drown out any plane chatter but bet baby will like it too she has white noise machine so bet she would knock out if fed her before the flight omg this is my worst nightmare flying hours with my 13 month old by myself tonight this it was actually much easier to fly with her when she was younger you can do it oh my goodness the internet does it again sarah you are amazing it was really hard for me to force yes out of my mouth but am so happy did it was faith in humanity restorative moment and am absolutely on the look out to be able to pay it forward you rock and you have some very lucky kiddos at home that for sure also recommend an aisle seat easier to get up and bounce oh man can even imagine flight that long you must have nerves of steel oddly enough take off and landing aren problem for us because of her ear tubes at least something good came from all those ear infections she is just such busy kid that being stuck is rough am sending you all the good feelings you can do it something that was hard to remember in the moment was it finite amount of time ask for help if you need it as learned yesterday people want to help this is just awesome yay for sarah in seattle also just actually read your name and phantompoop is brilliant aww you re too kind actually had seen you crying silently while your daughter slept so went and asked the flight attendant to check on you when she told me that you said it was just motion sickness thought hmmm don think so after she woke up and was having the meltdown felt couldn not offer to help even if you declined just so you at least didn feel alone anyways so happy that we could connect on here so many warm fuzzies today lt removed hahaha so considered making different account to reply because of it how did flying compare with walker my little guy has flown since he was months old but this upcoming flight will be our first since walking he not keen on being held for long periods of time when he knows an exciting world awaits him at ground level oh yes do it mo old flying is super easy trade you my yr old wo sleep on plane unless she is dead tired and that has sometimes been after 8+ hours with no nap at mo bit of rocking and she was out though do recommend headphones not so much for the volume but reduces the chance of wake ups when they do announcements its definitely harder with mobile kid toys snacks and usually movies will keep my yo occupied for most of the flight and letting her stand up if can thanks for being an amazing person sometimes want to offer help to other moms and hesitate because don want to seem like encroaching on their territory throwing all that to the wind next time thanks for the inspiration no way it awesome do it didn know needed it but did and bet the other moms and dads out there do too phew yeah was real mess definitely feeling the warm fuzzies and helping me stay awake and sort of alert today lt phew yeah was real mess definitely feeling the warm fuzzies and helping me stay awake and sort of alert today lt won lie to you it harder in the past we fly lot with family all over the east coast getting up and walking up and down the aisle usually helped lot kind of awkward and bumped into lot of people but helped with the wiggles for us this time exhaustion just got the better of us also usually hit up the thrift store before flight and buy bunch of smaller toys that she never seen before to get the novelty factor same with snacks buy bunch of treats she either never seen before or usually doesn get tworedditorsonecup flying with my daughter when she months nervous you did it mom way to go it takes village you made your daughter feel safe even though you were having tough time hugs to you think we would all gather in virtual group and toss sarah in the air chanting sarah sarah sarah me too my husband and went to wash our car the other day while our son was with my mil the lady in the car wash parking spot next to us was vacuuming her car and carrying her baby on her hip and had toddler with her my husband and were so impressed wanted so badly to ask her if could help by holding the baby or watching the toddler for minute or even if she wanted me to vacuum the car for her but was so nervous she be like uhh no thanks that didn do it next time will ask aaaaaaand crying this is too sweet haha do the same thing with snacks on flights so much so that when we go to the grocery store he knows what regular treat is and what an airplane treat is lol haha if anything hope ve inspired more moms to offer help the worst that can happen is they say no and you re embarrassed but the best thing that could happen is you make struggling mom feel less alone lt girl get the flying done before they can cruise walk don fly them from 18m 2y or until ipadable learned how rough that was with my first and my second just straight up didn go anywhere for months that said hours is cake grew up in ny and live in ca and have done cross country with two kids times year since both were infants it always just me daddy works ton and everyone has survived thus far it not as bad as you think it ll be the worst is when they are crawling then all the floor dirt in the airport is exciting and tasty looking and they yell if they are confined too long bestofreddit once they get mobile and don want to sit on you flying is the worst then they hit about and it bearable again because you can bribe them with special toys treats and devices we flew to europe from california with 17 month old worst mistake of my life we did however learn that the bathrooms make great sound barrier for screaming toddler you re the best sarah ca believe your kindness and generosity to this mom god bless you this is wonderful sharing in the fuzzies ve had some help why flew with my one year too faith in humanity is always restored when see stuff like that and so happy you found seattle sarah as mum of an active toddler who has traveled alone on plane and then five hour long bus ride immediately after thank you for your compassion as fellow parent and traveler always panic that going to have an out of control kid tired kid and we annoy the hell out of other passengers but so far ve ever only come across compassionate folks my husband and were invited to wedding in seattle his cousin but we didn go because we have and month old that like my worst fear is to take them on plane and watch them go buck wild didn take our oldest on plane until she was like glad you had help even if she says no it worth it was at restaurant with my husband and mo old he wasn having it this particular afternoon so we were passing him back and forth another mom came over to offer to hold him because she said she knows what it like to scarf down food said no thanks and told her what nice offer it was and then seriously told everyone know what happened because legitimately think it the nicest thing ever so sometimes just the offer is so so so good do 100k miles year and this is my nightmare but completely sympathetic to the fact there is nothing you can do but also huge male so offering to hold your child probably would be viewed differently except the one time was boarding flight and the woman in front of me was struggling to collapse her stroller while she held her infant asked if she needed hand and she said yes thank you and thrust her kid into my arms think was more surprised than the kid remember we are all human traveling is stressful someone who doesn get that and is an ass likely everyone hates them so you re ok there could pressure in her ears have been part of the problem if you have to fly with her again there trick to help ears pop paper foam coffee cups with paper napkin inside have the flight attendant drizzle hot water from the coffee machine onto the paper napkin hold the cup over your ear like headphones it makes steamy little pocket that helps pop ears one time flew with with raging sinus infection and thought was dying until someone brought me two cups and wet napkins this link has picture to explain it amp x200b http nourishinglittlesouls com the best trick for getting your kids ears to pop while flying http nourishinglittlesouls com the best trick for getting your kids ears to pop while flying so good to know my second does use soother if it were me the baby would probably come back crying harder xd are you me jk but did just fly last month alone with my then 4mo kiddo and missed my connecting flight so glad folks were kind to you too seems to help many but not my hubbie ugh chew gum
